description: The cause of the issue relates to the security vulnerability identified by CVE-2024-43468, which affected the configuration manager setup's management point. Prior to the release of the KB29166583 hotfix, customers were exposed to potential threats due to this vulnerability. The hotfix is designed to strengthen the security posture of the configuration management system and rectify the inadequacies of previously released hotfixes, KB28290310 and KB28458746, which were specific to version 2403 but did not contain the requisite fixes for this CVE. Installing the KB29166583 update is crucial for mitigating risks associated with this security issue. Microsoft emphasizes that this update is essential for all customers globally to ensure a hardened configuration manager deployment.
